ca.etsmtl.log430.lab1.presentation

Class Displays

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.etsmtl.log430.lab1.presentation.Displays

  • public class Displays
extends java.lang.Object
    This class displays various types of information on projects and resources (individually and as lists) to the screen.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Displays() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void displayProject(Project project)
      Displays a project object's elements as follows: ID, name, start date, end date, and priority.
      void displayProjectList(ProjectList list)
      Displays the projects in a project list.
      void displayProjectsAssignedToResource(Resource resource)
      Lists the projects currently assigned to a resource during this session.
      void displayProjectsInitiallyAssignedToResource(Resource resource)
      NEW Lists the projects initially assigned to any resources.
      void displayResource(Resource resource)
      Displays a resource object's elements as follows: Resource's first name, last name, ID number, role.
      void displayResourceList(ResourceList list)
      Displays the resources in a resource list.
      void displayResourcesAssignedToProject(Project project)
      Lists the resources that have been assigned to the project.
      void displayRole(java.lang.String role, int nbRoles)
      Displays a resource object's elements as follows: Role (number of persons assigned to.
      void displayRoleList(Project project)
      Displays the list or roles (previously assigned and currently assigned) and their number for a specific project.

      • Displays

        public Displays()

    • Method Detail

      • displayResource

        public void displayResource(Resource resource)
        Displays a resource object's elements as follows: Resource's first name, last name, ID number, role. Note that the projects previously assigned to the resource and the projects assigned to the resource in this execution of the system are not displayed.
        Parameters:
        resource -

      • displayRole

        public void displayRole(java.lang.String role,
               int nbRoles)
        Displays a resource object's elements as follows: Role (number of persons assigned to. this role).
        Parameters:
        resource -

      • displayProject

        public void displayProject(Project project)
        Displays a project object's elements as follows: ID, name, start date, end date, and priority. Note that the resources assigned to the project are not listed by this method.
        Parameters:
        project -

      • displayResourcesAssignedToProject

        public void displayResourcesAssignedToProject(Project project)
        Lists the resources that have been assigned to the project.
        Parameters:
        project -

      • displayProjectsAssignedToResource

        public void displayProjectsAssignedToResource(Resource resource)
        Lists the projects currently assigned to a resource during this session.
        Parameters:
        resource -

      • displayProjectsInitiallyAssignedToResource

        public void displayProjectsInitiallyAssignedToResource(Resource resource)
        NEW Lists the projects initially assigned to any resources.
        Parameters:
        resource -

      • displayRoleList

        public void displayRoleList(Project project)
        Displays the list or roles (previously assigned and currently assigned) and their number for a specific project.
        Parameters:
        project -

      • displayResourceList

        public void displayResourceList(ResourceList list)
        Displays the resources in a resource list. Displays the same information that is listed in the displayResource() method listed above.
        Parameters:
        list -

      • displayProjectList

        public void displayProjectList(ProjectList list)
        Displays the projects in a project list. Displays the same information that is listed in the displayProject() method listed above.
        Parameters:
        list -
